section.title: Installing, enabling, and updating &sapconf;
section.para: Before you install &sapconf;;, check if it is already installed on your system. To do this, run the which sapconf; command. Proceed with installing &sapconf;; if the command returns empty output.

note.para: On &sles4sap; the more advanced tool `saptune` is available and recommended to use. `sapconf` provides only a minimal set of tuning.

step.para: To install &sapconf; run the following command:

procedure.step:
Installing the package should automatically start the sapconf.service service. If needed, you can start the service manually by running the command below: &prompt.root;systemctl enable --now sapconf.service
&sapconf; and &saptune; cannot be active at the same time. If &saptune; is already tuning your system, you have to stop and disable saptune.service before you can start and enable sapconf.service.
